title: Machinery and Equipment Leasing
intro: Leasing is a flexible and cost-effective way to acquire the machinery and equipment your business needs without large upfront investments. On this page, you will find comprehensive information about the benefits, terms, and practical examples of leasing.

list.description: Possible buyout price at the end of the contract period.
Can be included in the contract or arranged separately.
Leasing contracts often include insurance coverage.
Leasing payments are usually tax-deductible for businesses.

vehicles.heading: Machinery and equipment available for leasing

rows: CNC machines, production lines, packaging machines

benefits.heading: Benefits of leasing for businesses
list: No large upfront investments – capital remains available for other uses.
Fixed monthly costs make budgeting easier.
Option to upgrade equipment at the end of the contract period.
Maintenance and servicing can be included in the contract.

cases.title: Construction company
cases.description: A construction company leased three excavators with a 48-month contract. The company was able to start a new project without a large capital outlay, and the equipment was always operational thanks to the maintenance agreement.

cases.title: Farm entrepreneur
cases.description: A farm entrepreneur acquired a new tractor through leasing. The fixed monthly payment made financial planning easier, and the machine was available for use quickly.

list.question: Can the leased item be purchased at the end of the contract?
list.answer: Yes, in most cases the equipment can be purchased for a separately agreed residual value.

list.question: Is maintenance included in the contract?
list.answer: Maintenance can be included in the contract or arranged separately as needed.

list.question: How does leasing affect business taxation?
list.answer: Leasing payments are usually tax-deductible for businesses.
